macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Japan Snap Elections Underway with LDP Poised for Majority
items.summary: Japan holds snap elections on February 8, 2026, with Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi's Liberal Democratic Party expected to secure a stand-alone majority, potentially boosting Nikkei 225 and TOPIX indices amid optimism. Markets anticipate moderate rally in Japanese stocks but volatility if coalition issues arise.

items.title: US Budget Disputes and S&P 500 Company Earnings Set Market Tone
items.summary: US faces budget disputes while key S&P 500 subsidiaries like CNA Financial report earnings on February 8, potentially influencing indices amid calm macro statistics. Strong profits could support S&P 500 gains; disappointments may trigger caution.

items.title: US Major Indices Mixed Last Week with Tech Selloff
items.summary: Nasdaq Composite fell 1.84% amid AI disruption worries, while S&P 500 was little changed; small-caps like Russell 2000 gained 7.59% YTD and S&P MidCap 400 up 8.53% YTD as investors rotate to value stocks.

items.title: Japan Nikkei Rises 1.75% Ahead of Elections
items.summary: Nikkei 225 gained 1.75% and TOPIX up 3.72% last week on election optimism, tempered by global AI concerns impacting software stocks.

items.title: Fed Eyes 3 Rate Cuts in 2026 Amid Job Market Weakness
items.summary: Scotiabank forecasts three Fed rate cuts to 3% this year as jobs teeter despite inflation risks; upcoming Fed speakers including Waller, Hammack, and Logan to provide insights ahead of FOMC.

items.title: AI Spending Boom Crowds Out Rest of Economy
items.summary: Mag7 tech giants' massive AI capex, including Nvidia's 2026 guidance, drives price pressures and shrinks non-tech capex and jobs, with implications for Fed policy.

items.title: AI Fears Trigger Major Tech Losses and Market Volatility
items.summary: AI disruption concerns sparked significant weekly losses in tech stocks; small-cap value remains undervalued amid high valuations elsewhere and rising bond volatility.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Bitcoin Rebounds to $68,459 Amid Market Recovery
items.summary: Bitcoin traded between $65,550 and $71,751 over the past 24 hours, closing at $68,459 with a 4.29% gain. The global cryptocurrency market cap reached $2.33 trillion, up 3.45% in the same period.

items.title: Dow Jumps 2.47% to Record Close as Crypto Stocks Post Sharp Gains
items.summary: Major stock indices reached record highs with cryptocurrency-related stocks, including MSTR, posting significant gains alongside the broader market recovery.

items.title: Federal Reserve Proposes Crypto Access to Payment Infrastructure
items.summary: The Federal Reserve's proposal to grant cryptocurrencies access to payment infrastructure has gained support, marking a significant regulatory development.

items.title: U.S. Government Maintains Strategic Bitcoin Reserve, Rules Out Market Intervention
items.summary: The U.S. government confirmed it will maintain its strategic Bitcoin holdings and will not intervene in cryptocurrency markets.

items.title: Ethereum and Major Altcoins Rally with Double-Digit Gains
items.summary: Ethereum surged 6.22% to $2,022.26, while Solana gained 6.48% and XRP jumped 7.79%. Bitcoin Cash led altcoin gains with a 10.47% increase.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: Crypto.com Co-Founder Launches ai.com with Autonomous AI Agents
items.summary: Kris Marszalek, Crypto.com co-founder, is launching ai.com on February 8, 2026, introducing autonomous AI agents that perform tasks like scheduling and messaging, aiming to evolve AI from chat tools to action-oriented virtual assistants with shared learning capabilities.

items.title: $70 Million ai.com Domain Set for Super Bowl Premiere of Autonomous AI Agents
items.summary: ai.com, founded by Crypto.com CEO Kris Marszalek, will launch consumer-facing autonomous AI agents with a Super Bowl LX ad on February 8, 2026, positioning it as a potential gateway to AGI through decentralized agent networks.

items.title: AI-Generated Text Sparks 'Arms Race' with Detectors, Overwhelming Institutions
items.summary: AI-generated content is flooding newspapers, journals, courts, and social media, creating a no-win arms race with detection tools; experts suggest assistive AI could strengthen institutions despite challenges.

items.title: MIT Researchers Advance AI for Antibiotic Discovery with New ARPA-H Grant
items.summary: MIT's lab received an ARPA-H grant to use generative AI and deep learning to design 15 new antibiotics as pre-clinical candidates, building on 2025 studies to combat multi-drug-resistant pathogens through integrated computational and experimental approaches.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: Nvidia Reportedly Delays RTX 60 Series Gaming GPUs Until 2028 Due to VRAM Supply Issues
items.summary: Nvidia is not releasing new RTX gaming GPUs in 2026, with the RTX 60 series potentially delayed until 2028 due to VRAM supply constraints despite strong demand for current models. Mass production may not start until late 2027.

items.title: Five Video Game Stocks Flagged to Watch on February 7: Turtle Beach, Alliance Entertainment, and Others
items.summary: MarketBeat highlights Turtle Beach (TBCH), Alliance Entertainment (AENT), Allied Gaming & Entertainment (AGAE), Motorsport Games (MSGM), and Brag House (TBH) as top video game stocks based on high trading volume, spanning peripherals, esports, and racing games.

items.title: CES 2026 Preview: Micro RGB Displays Promise Revolution for Gamers with Enhanced HDR and Motion Handling
items.summary: CES 2026 will showcase Micro RGB technology in TVs, offering benefits for gamers like reduced motion blur at 120Hz+, brighter HDR in lit rooms, and AI-driven image adjustments for gaming and streaming.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.

items.title: Amazon Shares Plunge 7% on $200 Billion 2026 Capex Guidance
items.summary: Amazon's stock dropped 7% due to announced massive capital expenditures of about $200 billion in 2026, focused on infrastructure, custom chips, robotics, and projects like Project Kuiper, raising investor concerns over margins and cash flow.

items.title: Trump Endorses Nexstar's $6.2 Billion Acquisition of Tegna
items.summary: President Donald Trump praised Nexstar Media Group's $6.2 billion purchase of broadcast rival Tegna on social media, reversing his earlier opposition and arguing it increases competition against national TV networks.

items.title: D-Wave Quantum Secures $10 Million QCaaS Deal with Fortune 100 Company
items.summary: D-Wave Quantum announced a $10 million, two-year Enterprise Quantum Computing as a Service (QCaaS) agreement with a leading Fortune 100 company.
